newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bonds start up, mood good, focus on Germany.
newsitem.headline: Danish bonds start up, mood good, focus on Germany.

text.p: Danish bond prices opened higher on Thursday in a positive market buoyed by Wall Street advances with dealers focusing on the morning's German Ifo data.
"The outlook looks positive but the big question is how we react to the German Ifo business climate data," one dealer said.

The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 opened up 0.22 point from Wednesday's close at 109.62. The 10-year yield gap with Germany was unchanged at 72 basis points. The crown opened at 3.8088 per mark, weakening a tad from Wednesday's closing 3.8085.
